ids_info.name: sawteeth
ids_info.description: Description of sawtooth events. This IDS must be used in homogeneous_time = 1 mode

sawteeth/vacuum_toroidal_field.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: sawteeth/vacuum_toroidal_field
IDS: sawteeth
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 1
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 2
PARENT_CONTAINER: sawteeth
FIELD_NAME: vacuum_toroidal_field
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: sawteeth -> vacuum_toroidal_field

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field (used in rho_tor definition)

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[sawteeth]: Description of sawtooth events. This IDS must be used in homogeneous_time = 1 mode

sawteeth/vacuum_toroidal_field/r0.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: sawteeth/vacuum_toroidal_field/r0
IDS: sawteeth
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 2
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 3
PARENT_CONTAINER: sawteeth/vacuum_toroidal_field
FIELD_NAME: r0
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: sawteeth -> vacuum_toroidal_field -> r0

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Reference major radius where the vacuum toroidal magnetic field is given (usually a fixed position such as the middle of the vessel at the equatorial midplane)

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[sawteeth]: Description of sawtooth events. This IDS must be used in homogeneous_time = 1 mode
CONTAINER[sawteeth/vacuum_toroidal_field]: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field (used in rho_tor definition)

sawteeth/vacuum_toroidal_field/b0.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: sawteeth/vacuum_toroidal_field/b0
IDS: sawteeth
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 2
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 3
PARENT_CONTAINER: sawteeth/vacuum_toroidal_field
FIELD_NAME: b0
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: sawteeth -> vacuum_toroidal_field -> b0

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Vacuum toroidal field at R0 [T]; Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewing from above. The product R0B0 must be consistent with the b_tor_vacuum_r field of the tf IDS.

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[sawteeth]: Description of sawtooth events. This IDS must be used in homogeneous_time = 1 mode
CONTAINER[sawteeth/vacuum_toroidal_field]: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field (used in rho_tor definition)

sawteeth/crash_trigger.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: sawteeth/crash_trigger
IDS: sawteeth
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 1
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 2
PARENT_CONTAINER: sawteeth
FIELD_NAME: crash_trigger
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: sawteeth -> crash_trigger

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Flag indicating whether a crash condition has been satisfied : 0 = no crash. N(>0) = crash triggered due to condition N as follows. 1: crash triggered by the ideal kink criterion; 2: crash triggered by the ideal kink criterion including kinetic effects from fast particles; 31: crash triggered by the resistive kink criterion (meeting necessary conditions for reconnection); 32: crash triggered by the resistive kink criterion (resistive kink mode is unstable). The distinction between 31 and 32 only indicates whether (31) or (32) was the last criterion to be satisfied

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[sawteeth]: Description of sawtooth events. This IDS must be used in homogeneous_time = 1 mode

sawteeth/profiles_1d/grid/rho_tor_norm.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: sawteeth/profiles_1d/grid/rho_tor_norm
IDS: sawteeth
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: sawteeth/profiles_1d/grid
FIELD_NAME: rho_tor_norm
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: sawteeth -> profiles_1d -> grid -> rho_tor_norm

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Normalized toroidal flux coordinate. The normalizing value for rho_tor_norm, is the toroidal flux coordinate at the equilibrium boundary (LCFS or 99.x % of the LCFS in case of a fixed boundary equilibium calculation, see time_slice/boundary/b_flux_pol_norm in the equilibrium IDS) 

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[sawteeth]: Description of sawtooth events. This IDS must be used in homogeneous_time = 1 mode
CONTAINER[sawteeth/profiles_1d]: Core profiles after sawtooth crash for various time slices
CONTAINER[sawteeth/profiles_1d/grid]: Radial grid

sawteeth/profiles_1d/grid/rho_tor.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: sawteeth/profiles_1d/grid/rho_tor
IDS: sawteeth
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: sawteeth/profiles_1d/grid
FIELD_NAME: rho_tor
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: sawteeth -> profiles_1d -> grid -> rho_tor

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Toroidal flux coordinate = sqrt(phi/(pi*b0)), where the toroidal magnetic field, b0, corresponds to that stored in vacuum_toroidal_field/b0 and pi can be found in the IMAS constants

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[sawteeth]: Description of sawtooth events. This IDS must be used in homogeneous_time = 1 mode
CONTAINER[sawteeth/profiles_1d]: Core profiles after sawtooth crash for various time slices
CONTAINER[sawteeth/profiles_1d/grid]: Radial grid

sawteeth/profiles_1d/grid/rho_pol_norm.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: sawteeth/profiles_1d/grid/rho_pol_norm
IDS: sawteeth
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: sawteeth/profiles_1d/grid
FIELD_NAME: rho_pol_norm
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: sawteeth -> profiles_1d -> grid -> rho_pol_norm

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Normalized poloidal flux coordinate = sqrt((psi(rho)-psi(magnetic_axis)) / (psi(LCFS)-psi(magnetic_axis)))

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[sawteeth]: Description of sawtooth events. This IDS must be used in homogeneous_time = 1 mode
CONTAINER[sawteeth/profiles_1d]: Core profiles after sawtooth crash for various time slices
CONTAINER[sawteeth/profiles_1d/grid]: Radial grid

sawteeth/profiles_1d/grid/psi.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: sawteeth/profiles_1d/grid/psi
IDS: sawteeth
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: sawteeth/profiles_1d/grid
FIELD_NAME: psi
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: sawteeth -> profiles_1d -> grid -> psi

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Poloidal magnetic flux. Integral of magnetic field passing through a contour defined by the intersection of a flux surface passing through the point of interest and a Z=constant plane. If the integration surface is flat, the surface normal vector is in the increasing vertical coordinate direction, Z, namely upwards.

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[sawteeth]: Description of sawtooth events. This IDS must be used in homogeneous_time = 1 mode
CONTAINER[sawteeth/profiles_1d]: Core profiles after sawtooth crash for various time slices
CONTAINER[sawteeth/profiles_1d/grid]: Radial grid
